definition: to disappear/to vanish/to eliminate/to spend (time)/have to/need
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw

sentences.english: There has always been one major caveat, however, to the research on the fade-out effect.
sentences.chinese: 但是消退效应有一个致命的软肋。

sentences.english: I expect food inflation to subside by early spring.
sentences.chinese: 我预测，今年早春时节，食品通胀就能消退。

sentences.english: The bad image that love hotels had has faded over time.
sentences.chinese: 随着时间的推移，情人旅馆的坏名声消退了。

sentences.english: I slept somewhat late owing to my slight cold, which seems now to have subsided.
sentences.chinese: 虽然我有曾略受风寒而晏起，风寒现已消退。

sentences.english: wouldn't there be extinction after a while?
sentences.chinese: 在强化消失后是否也会发生消退？

sentences.english: But this is telling us that it does and that the fade-out effect is misleading in some sense.
sentences.chinese: 此前的消退效应，在一定意义上是一种误导。

sentences.english: This is not only because of the iron law of waning novelty.
sentences.chinese: 这不仅仅是因为新意必将逐渐消退的铁则。

sentences.english: Newspaper is in the monopoly power of journalism already subsidise , competition will be permanent exist.
sentences.chinese: 报纸在新闻界的垄断力已消退，竞争将永久存在。

sentences.english: 2 weeks after admission to hospital, the patient's left leg pain had completely resolved, and the swelling went down gradually.
sentences.chinese: 入院后2周病人左腿疼痛完全缓解，肿胀逐渐消退。

sentences.english: Occasionally, a simple bone cyst may undergo spontaneous regression.
sentences.chinese: 在少数病例中，单纯性骨囊肿可能会自然消退。

sentences.english: The snow line here has risen 150 meters, and glaciers have retreated by 10 kilometers.
sentences.chinese: 雪线升高了150米，冰川也因此消退了10千米。

sentences.english: Conclusions The efficacy of sulindac is significant in regressing colonic adenomas of patients with FAP.
sentences.chinese: 结论舒林酸对FAP疗效显著，可使腺瘤明显消退。

sentences.english: However, 95 percent of perianal gland adenomas will disappear after neutering the dog.
sentences.chinese: 然而95%的肛周腺腺瘤在绝育后会自发消退。

sentences.english: Just make sure you avoid vigorous activity until the soreness has subsided.
sentences.chinese: 确保避免高强度运动直到酸痛消退。

sentences.english: Yet tonight, we take comfort in knowing that the tide of war is receding.
sentences.chinese: 不过今晚，让我们宽慰的是，战争的浪潮正在消退。

sentences.english: When the spread normalizes , it would tell us that speculation is unwinding.
sentences.chinese: 当利率差回归正常水平时，它告诉我们投机正在消退。

definition: to water down/to play down/to trivialize/to weaken/to become dull with time/to desalinate/desalination
to improve/to take a turn for the better/improvement
to take off (one's clothes)/(fig.) to shed (one's former image etc)/(of a fad or the after-effects of a disaster etc) to subside/also pr. [tun4 qu4]
to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
to pull back/to shrink/to contract/(physiology) systole
(literary) to eliminate/to put an end to
to recover completely (from illness or injury)
